s1.name: Recent news
s1.subtitle: 1th May 2002: AshnaMQ supports the Test Suite
s1.p: Thanks to AshnaSoft team, both AshnaMQ Standard and Enterprise Edition are available for the Test Suite. Thanks!
As usual, the package has been updated with their Admin (and new tests). For more information, see the documentation
s1.subtitle: 23rd April 2002: Pramati supports the Test Suite
s1.p: Thanks to Rajdeep Dua, Pramati has contributed to the Test Suite and offered an Admin implementation to use the Test Suite with both their Application Server and Message Server. Thanks Rajdeep!
The package available for download has been updated with Pramati Admin implementation. For more information, see the documentation
s1.subtitle: 15th April 2002: Test Suite web pages and package available
s1.p: The Test Suite has now its own web pages. Any feedback is welcome
As requested by some people, the Test Suite is now also available as a package.

s1.name: About
s1.p: This Test Suite is available under LGPL. it tests JMSTM features and its code base is pure JMSTM without dependency from any vendor.
Technically, the administration step is done through a simple interface that any provider can implement. For the moment, we provide implementations for:
(a SwiftMQ one will be provided soon).
We suggest that other JMS providers implement this interface so that the suite can be used by potential users to test implementations with respect to well known test scenarios.

s1.name: Mailing List
s1.p: A mailing list (test@objectweb.org) has been created to discuss about this test suite. It is moderated to avoid spam but you're welcome to subscribe if you're interested by using or developing the Test Suite.
To subscribe, send a mail to sympa@objectweb.org with in the message body: subscribe test.

s1.name: Getting involved
s1.p: Any input or personal view for improving and/or developing this test suite is welcome. This test suite, as an open source project, also welcomes external contributions from JMSTM users or developers. Interested? Contact us.
